Please check the field:
Fields

Purpose: Demonstrate Field Logic Chain(s).

  • Obscure irrelevant fields
  • Highlight relevant fields
  • Delineate Focus Field (field with logic chain)
  • Indicate Explicit Circular Logic
  • Indicate Implied

Focus Field = Field or Section with logic ascribed to it.  Field whose visibility is determined by the values of other fields.

Not relevant section = Trivial Section.. No section should be used in logic expressions. However, fields within sections can be used in logic expression and those sections can be hidden.

Relevant field = Trivial Section.. No section should be used in logic expressions. However, fields within sections can be used in logic expression and those sections can be hidden.  Effectively the fields have implied logic.

Circular Logic = The field directly creates circular logic. A Logic Chain is built by taking a single node (focus field) and adding a logic rule (which will involve another field). If new rule creates a circular reference it will be highlighted in red. To make the circular pattern more clear two nodes will be indicated (node with the rule and the node the rule refers to).

*Implied Logic Section logic that effects the visibility of the children fields. The field themselves have no logic but section they belong to, have logic, effectively ascribing logic to the field.
Implied Logic will is indicated when a Relevant field is contained in an irrelevant section. Not relevant section

Field with Implied Logic







.

 A->B->C-D->E->A (logic)
Interesting to note that the Circular Logic Fields will change depending on the Focus Field.

(A) A->B->C-D->E->A (logic)
(B) A->B->C-D->E->A (logic)
(C) A->B->C-D->E->A (logic)
(D) A->B->C-D->E->A (logic)
(E) A->B->C-D->E->A (logic)

Non - Conflict, independent logic tree

Switzerland

Inter-dependent (fixed with 'any')

Section visibility is determined by fields hidden within section.  

Fields: A, A.0, A.1, B, B.0, B.1 all have implied logic.
Field: "Switzerland" belongs in a different section that may have it's own logic.
Focus Field (this section) has broken logic in that it's visibility depends on its dependent fields.

A
A.0
A.1
B
B.0
B.1

Triangle - ideal use

Section visibility is determined by fields hidden within section.  

Fields: A, A.0, A.1, B, B.0, B.1 all have implied logic.
Field: "Switzerland" belongs in a different section that may have it's own logic.
Focus Field (this section) has broken logic in that it's visibility depends on its dependent fields.

A (ideal)
A.0 (ideal)
A.1 (ideal)
B (ideal)
B.0 (ideal)
B.1 (ideal)

Big Dipper + Leaf

D depends on B and E (D -> (B^E))
A depends on B (A->B), B depends on C (B->C), C depends on D (C->D), D depends on B and E.  Effectively, A->B->C->D->(B^E).

The circular reference is contained between B...E.  "A" points to a dependency chain with circular reference but "A" does not participate in the circular reference.

Note that moving the Focus Field from A to other fields shows slightly different dependency chains. 

(A) Big Dipper A->B->C->D->(B ^ E)
(B) Big Dipper A->B->C->D->(B ^ E)
(C) Big Dipper A->B->C->D->(B ^ E)
(D) Big Dipper A->B->C->D->(B ^ E)

Redundant - non conflict

Cancel
Confirm

Purpose: Demonstrate Field Logic Chain(s).

  • Obscure irrelevant fields
  • Highlight relevant fields
  • Delineate Focus Field (field with logic chain)
  • Indicate Explicit Circular Logic
  • Indicate Implied

Focus Field = Field or Section with logic ascribed to it.  Field whose visibility is determined by the values of other fields.

Not relevant section = Trivial Section.. No section should be used in logic expressions. However, fields within sections can be used in logic expression and those sections can be hidden.

Relevant field = Trivial Section.. No section should be used in logic expressions. However, fields within sections can be used in logic expression and those sections can be hidden.  Effectively the fields have implied logic.

Circular Logic = The field directly creates circular logic. A Logic Chain is built by taking a single node (focus field) and adding a logic rule (which will involve another field). If new rule creates a circular reference it will be highlighted in red. To make the circular pattern more clear two nodes will be indicated (node with the rule and the node the rule refers to).

*Implied Logic Section logic that effects the visibility of the children fields. The field themselves have no logic but section they belong to, have logic, effectively ascribing logic to the field.

.

The circular reference is contained between B...E.  "A" points to a dependency chain with circular reference but "A" does not participate in the circular reference.
